course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Discovering Mind and Behavior
course.description: This course introduces the fundamental scientific knowledge about human thinking and behavior processes and illustrates the relevance of this knowledge to the betterment of human performance and well-being in a wide variety of settings in society.
course.prerequisites: a passing letter grade in LANG 1401 OR LANG 1402 OR LANG 1403 OR LANG 1404 OR LANG 1002 (prior to 2022-23)

reviews.author: kkqi
reviews.comment_content: Rich content about introduction to psychology, discussing most well-research fields.
reviews.comment_teaching: He did an amazing job in teaching the content of the course with detailed explanations (videos, real-life examples, etc). Interacting quizzes during lectures will do help students build a concrete understanding of the content. He will answer all the questions you ask during or after the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
1 exam at upper quartile
1 exam above mean 1 s.d.
1 essay at mean
1 essay below mean a bit
finished all off-class exercises

and I got a B+. -_-
